title: Teku 23.6.0 having issues with GNOSIS chain
body:
<!-- 
By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with the Code of Conduct, 
including treating everyone with respect:
https://github.com/ConsenSys/teku/blob/master/CODE-OF-CONDUCT.md

Not all sections will apply to all issue types.
-->

### Description
[Detailed description of the problem and the impact it has]
Significant reduction in effectiveness caused by periodical low counts (0-70%）of correct target and head.
Sometimes with "ERROR - Refusing to sign attestation" 
### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
[Please be as specific as possible]
Upgrade TEKU from 23.4.0 to 23.6.0 using eth-docker stack.
Downgrade back to 23.4.0 or 23.5.0 both behave normally.
**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
No change in the validation process
**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
ERROR log：[message.1.txt](https://github.com/ConsenSys/teku/files/11814721/message.1.txt)

**Frequency:** [How regularly does it occur?]
Always with bad attestation performance but only log ERROR after running for a while (an hour also). 
### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Software version: [`teku --version` or look for log lines starting with `Teku version:`] 23.6.0
* Java version: [`java -version`] java-17
* OS Name & Version: [`cat /etc/*release`] Ubuntu 22.04
* Docker Version: [`docker version`] 24.0.2
* Cloud VM, type, size: [Amazon Web Services I3-large] N/A
* Nethermind version: 1.19.2
* eth-docker version: 2.2.9.2
